meanings.sent1: He diddled his friend out of his lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The con artist diddled many people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox diddled the rabbit out of its carrots.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth talk diddled him into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The magician diddled the audience with his clever tricks.

meanings.sent1: She diddled the controls to fix the settings.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic diddled with the engine to make it run better.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child diddled with the TV remote.
meanings.sent4: The hacker diddled the security system to gain access.
meanings.sent5: The artist diddled with the colors to create a beautiful painting.

meanings.definition: To engage in sexual activity with someone, especially in a deceitful or non-consensual manner.
meanings.sent1: It is never okay to diddle someone without their consent.
meanings.sent2: The villain in the story tried to diddle the innocent character.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show made a joke about a spy who diddled the enemy for information.
meanings.sent4: The scandal involved a politician who diddled with multiple partners.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed a dark character who diddled unsuspecting victims.
